cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast Thursday and accelerate northeastward parallel to, or just brushing, the Southeast U.S. Atlantic coastline toward the Carolinas and the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Savannah River GA; Hurricane Warning north of Savannah River to NC/VA border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. Atlantic coastline from northeastern Florida through the Carolinas and into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (â‰¤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; mainly breezy conditions possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf side where the port is located.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer-band showers possible, rainfall generally less than 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along west-central Florida beaches.
